abstract: Reps Hakeem Jeffries of New York and Doug Collins from Georgia introduce bill that would prohibit federal prosecutors from reading emails sent between prison inmates and their lawyers; bill stems from report that Brooklyn federal prosecutors had informed prisoners that they would be monitoring their emails, practice that is occurring across country as increasing number of lawyers find email systems efficient means of communication.
lead_paragraph: A bill introduced by Representatives Hakeem Jeffries of New York and Doug Collins of Georgia would end a practice that has divided federal judges.

headline.main: 2 Congressmen Propose Barring U.S. Prosecutors From Reading Inmates’ Emails to Lawyers
headline.print_headline: Bill Seeks to Bar U.S. Prosecutors From Reading Inmates’ Emails to Lawyers

snippet: A bill introduced by Representatives Hakeem Jeffries of New York and Doug Collins of Georgia would end a practice that has divided federal judges.
